searchParam.name: _count
searchParam.documentation: Number of results per page.

searchParam.name: _id
searchParam.documentation: FHIR resource IDs for the desired resources. Can be used in combination with _count, _include, and _revInclude. All others will be ignored.

searchParam.name: research-subject
searchParam.documentation: Search for AdverseEvent resources for a specified research study participant.

searchParam.name: seriousness
searchParam.documentation: Refine a search for AdverseEvent resources by seriousness of the event. Serious and Non-serious are the only supported values.

searchParam.name: study
searchParam.documentation: Search for AdverseEvent resources for a specified study ID.

searchParam.name: subject
searchParam.documentation: Search for AdverseEvent resources for a specified patient ID.

searchParam.name: _count
searchParam.documentation: Number of results per page.

searchParam.name: _id
searchParam.documentation: FHIR resource IDs for the desired resources. Can be used in combination with _count, _include, and _revInclude. All others will be ignored.

searchParam.name: clinical-status
searchParam.documentation: Refine a search for AllergyIntolerance resources by clinicalStatus. Active is the only supported clinical status to search by.

searchParam.name: patient
searchParam.documentation: Search for AllergyIntolerance resources for a specified patient ID.

searchParam.name: _count
searchParam.documentation: Number of results per page.

searchParam.name: _id
searchParam.documentation: FHIR resource IDs for the desired resources. Can be used in combination with _count, _include, and _revInclude. All others will be ignored.

searchParam.name: onlyscannable
searchParam.documentation: Refine a search for Appointment resources to scannable appointments only. By default, all Appointments are returned. Use a value of "true" to only return scannable appointments. Can only be used when the application is launched from Hyperspace.

searchParam.name: patient
searchParam.documentation: Search for Appointment resources for a specified patient ID.

searchParam.name: service-category
searchParam.documentation: Search on the type of appointment. Enter 'surgery' for scheduled surgery appointments, and 'appointment' for all other types of appointments.

searchParam.name: _count
searchParam.documentation: Number of results per page.

searchParam.name: _id
searchParam.documentation: FHIR resource IDs for the desired resources. Can be used in combination with _count, _include, and _revInclude. All others will be ignored.

searchParam.name: _count
searchParam.documentation: Number of results per page.

searchParam.name: _id
searchParam.documentation: FHIR resource IDs for the desired resources. Can be used in combination with _count, _include, and _revInclude. All others will be ignored.

searchParam.name: identifier
searchParam.documentation: Refine a search for BodyStructure resources by identifier. Enter using the structure "[system]|[search string]".

searchParam.name: location
searchParam.documentation: Refine a search for BodyStructure resources by location.

searchParam.name: morphology
searchParam.documentation: Refine a search for BodyStructure resources by morphology.

searchParam.name: patient
searchParam.documentation: Search for BodyStructure resources for a specified patient ID. You can use "patient" or "subject" equivalently, but they cannot be used at the same time for different references.

searchParam.name: subject
searchParam.documentation: Search for BodyStructure resources for a specified patient ID. You can use "patient" or "subject" equivalently, but they cannot be used at the same time for different references.

searchParam.name: _count
searchParam.documentation: Number of results per page.

searchParam.name: _id
searchParam.documentation: FHIR resource IDs for the desired resources. Can be used in combination with _count, _include, and _revInclude. All others will be ignored.

searchParam.name: category
searchParam.documentation: Search for CarePlans of the given type. This is a required search parameter.

searchParam.name: patient
searchParam.documentation: Search for CarePlan resources using a specified patient ID. You can use "patient" or "subject" equivalently, but they cannot be used at the same time for different references.

searchParam.name: subject
searchParam.documentation: Search for CarePlan resources using a specified patient ID. You can use "patient" or "subject" equivalently, but they cannot be used at the same time for different references.

searchParam.name: _count
searchParam.documentation: Number of results per page.

searchParam.name: _id
searchParam.documentation: FHIR resource IDs for the desired resources. Can be used in combination with _count, _include, and _revInclude. All others will be ignored.

searchParam.name: patient
searchParam.documentation: Search for CareTeam resources using a specified patient ID. You can use "patient" or "subject" equivalently, but they cannot be used at the same time for different references.

searchParam.name: status
searchParam.documentation: Refine a search based on the CareTeam's status. Currently only active is supported.

searchParam.name: subject
searchParam.documentation: Search for CareTeam resources using a specified patient ID. You can use "patient" or "subject" equivalently, but they cannot be used at the same time for different references.

searchParam.name: _id
searchParam.documentation: FHIR resource IDs for the desired resources. Can be used in combination with _count, _include, and _revInclude. All others will be ignored.

searchParam.name: category
searchParam.documentation: Refine a search to include only Communication resources with the given categories.

searchParam.name: encounter
searchParam.documentation: Refine a search to include Communication resources from only the encounters provided.

searchParam.name: patient

searchParam.name: abatement-date
searchParam.documentation: Search for Conditions with a specified abatement date.

searchParam.name: category
searchParam.documentation: Search for Condition resources by category.

searchParam.name: clinical-status
searchParam.documentation: Refine a search for Condition resources by clinicalStatus. Only clinical statuses of 'inactive', 'resolved' and 'active' are supported for health concerns and problem list items. Only clinical statuses of 'inactive' and 'active' are supported for infections.

searchParam.name: code
searchParam.documentation: Search for Conditions with a specified code.

searchParam.name: encounter
searchParam.documentation: Search for Condition resources for specific encounters.

searchParam.name: onset-date
searchParam.documentation: Search for Conditions with a specified onset date.

searchParam.name: patient
searchParam.documentation: Search for Condition resources for a specified patient ID. You can use "patient" or "subject" equivalently, but they cannot be used at the same time for different references.

searchParam.name: recorded-date
searchParam.documentation: Search for Conditions with a specified recorded date.

searchParam.name: subject
searchParam.documentation: Search for Condition resources for a specified patient ID. You can use "patient" or "subject" equivalently, but they cannot be used at the same time for different references.

searchParam.name: _id
searchParam.documentation: FHIR resource IDs for the desired resources. Can be used in combination with _count, _include, and _revInclude. All others will be ignored.

searchParam.name: device-name
searchParam.documentation: A string that will match the Device.deviceName.name field. Not case sensitive.

searchParam.name: manufacturer
searchParam.documentation: Manufacturer of the device.

searchParam.name: model
searchParam.documentation: Model number of the device.

searchParam.name: patient
searchParam.documentation: The patient in whom this device is implanted. This is a required parameter.

searchParam.name: udi-carrier
searchParam.documentation: The UDI barcode string - matches static UDI.

searchParam.name: udi-di
searchParam.documentation: The UDI device identifier (DI).

searchParam.name: _count
searchParam.documentation: Number of results per page.

searchParam.name: _id
searchParam.documentation: FHIR resource IDs for the desired resources. Can be used in combination with _count, _include, and _revInclude. All others will be ignored.

searchParam.name: patient
searchParam.documentation: Search for DeviceRequest resource for a specified patient ID.

searchParam.name: status
searchParam.documentation: Search for a DeviceRequest based on a device request status

searchParam.documentation: Number of results per page.

searchParam.name: _id
searchParam.documentation: FHIR resource IDs for the desired resources. Can be used in combination with _count, _include, and _revInclude. All others will be ignored.

searchParam.name: patient
searchParam.documentation: Search for DeviceUseStatement resources for a specified patient ID. You can use "patient" or "subject" equivalently, but they cannot be used at the same time for different references.

searchParam.name: category
searchParam.documentation: Refine a search for DiagnosticReport resources by category.

searchParam.name: code
searchParam.documentation: Refine a search for DiagnosticReport resources by code.

searchParam.name: date
searchParam.documentation: Refine a search for DiagnosticReport resources by specifying a date or date range that a DiagnosticReport was resulted or recorded. Enter dates in ISO format (YYYY[-MM[-DD[THH:MM[:SS][TZ]]]]). Local server time is assumed if time zone information is not included.

searchParam.name: identifier
searchParam.documentation: Refine search by specifying an identifier, such as the internal order ID or the accession number.

searchParam.name: patient
searchParam.documentation: Search for DiagnosticReport resources for a specified patient ID. You can use "patient" or "subject" equivalently, but they cannot be used at the same time for different references.

searchParam.name: subject
searchParam.documentation: Search for DiagnosticReport resources for a specified patient ID. You can use "patient" or "subject" equivalently, but they cannot be used at the same time for different references.

searchParam.name: _count
searchParam.documentation: Number of results per page.

searchParam.name: _id
searchParam.documentation: FHIR resource IDs for the desired resources. Can be used in combination with _count, _include, and _revInclude. All others will be ignored.

searchParam.name: author
searchParam.documentation: Further refine a search for a given set of DocumentReferences on a patient by specifying a Reference that corresponds to the author of the document.

searchParam.name: category
searchParam.documentation: Refine a search for DocumentReference resources by category.

searchParam.name: date
searchParam.documentation: Further refine a search for a given set of DocumentReferences on a patient by specifying a date or date range in ISO format (YYYY[-MM[-DD[THH:MM[:SS][TZ]]]]]) that corresponds to the document creation time. Local server time is assumed if time zone information is not included.

searchParam.name: docstatus
searchParam.documentation: Further refine a search for a given set of DocumentReferences on a patient by specifying a docStatus. By default, all docStatuses are returned.

searchParam.name: encounter
searchParam.documentation: Search for DocumentReference resources for a specific internal or external encounter

searchParam.name: patient
searchParam.documentation: Search for DocumentReference resources for a specified patient ID. You can use "patient" or "subject" equivalently, but they cannot be used at the same time for different references.

searchParam.name: period
searchParam.documentation: Further refine a search for a given set of DocumentReferences on a patient by specifying a date or date range in ISO format (YYYY[-MM[-DD]]) that corresponds to the time of the service that is being documented.

searchParam.name: status
searchParam.documentation: Further refine a search for a given set of DocumentReferences on a patient by specifying a status of the document.

searchParam.name: subject
searchParam.documentation: Search for DocumentReference resources for a specified patient ID. You can use "patient" or "subject" equivalently, but they cannot be used at the same time for different references.

searchParam.name: type
searchParam.documentation: Further refine a search for a given set of DocumentReferences on a patient by specifying a type code to return only documents of that type. Use the format: type=<code> to search all supported systems with that code or type=<system>|<code> to further refine the search to one code system. Not supported for questionnaire-response search.

searchParam.name: _count
searchParam.documentation: Number of results per page.

searchParam.name: _id
searchParam.documentation: FHIR resource IDs for the desired resources. Can be used in combination with _count, _include, and _revInclude. All others will be ignored.

searchParam.name: _lastupdated
searchParam.documentation: Further refine a search by the date list in meta.lastupdated.

searchParam.name: class
searchParam.documentation: Refine a search for Encounter resources by class. By default, all classes are returned.

searchParam.name: date
searchParam.documentation: Refine a search for Encounter resources by date. By default, all Encounters are returned. Enter dates in ISO format (YYYY[-MM[-DD[THH:MM[:SS][TZ]]]]]). Local server time is assumed if time zone information is not included.

searchParam.name: identifier
searchParam.documentation: Search for Encounter resources by encounter identifier in the format <code system>|<code>

searchParam.name: onlyscannable
searchParam.documentation: Refine a search for Encounter resources to scannable encounters only. By default, all Encounters are returned. Use a value of "true" to only return scannable encounters. Can only be used when the application is launched from Hyperspace.

searchParam.name: patient
searchParam.documentation: Search for Encounter resources for a specified patient ID. You can use "patient" or "subject" equivalently, but they cannot be used at the same time for difference references.

searchParam.name: subject
searchParam.documentation: Search for Encounter resources for a specified patient ID. You can use "patient" or "subject" equivalently, but they cannot be used at the same time for difference references.

searchParam.documentation: Number of results per page.

searchParam.name: use
searchParam.documentation: Refine a search for ExplanationOfBenefit by use. By default, the search returns all uses. Use of claim and preauthorization are supported.

searchParam.documentation: Number of results per page.

searchParam.name: _id
searchParam.documentation: FHIR resource IDs for the desired resources. Can be used in combination with _count, _include, and _revInclude. All others will be ignored.

searchParam.name: patient
searchParam.documentation: Required: the patient whose family history you'd like to search.

searchParam.name: _id

searchParam.documentation: Refine a search for MedicationAdministration resources for a given patient by specifying a date or a range of dates for the administration.

searchParam.name: patient
searchParam.documentation: Search for MedicationAdministration resources for a specified patient ID. You can use "patient" and "subject" equivalently, but they cannot be used at the same time for different references.

searchParam.name: performer
searchParam.documentation: Refine a search for MedicationAdministration resources by one or more associated reference.

searchParam.name: request
searchParam.documentation: Refine a search for MedicationAdministration resources by associated reference.

searchParam.name: status
searchParam.documentation: Refine a search for MedicationAdministration resources with one or more statuses.

searchParam.name: subject

searchParam.name: date

searchParam.name: intent
searchParam.documentation: Refine a search for MedicationRequest resources by one or more intents.

searchParam.name: patient

searchParam.name: subject

searchParam.name: _id

searchParam.name: _count
searchParam.documentation: Number of results per page.

searchParam.name: _id
searchParam.documentation: FHIR resource IDs for the desired resources. Can be used in combination with _count, _include, and _revInclude. All others will be ignored.

searchParam.name: based-on
searchParam.documentation: Refine a search for Observation resources by specifying a Reference associated with the Observation.

searchParam.name: category
searchParam.documentation: Refine a search for Observation resources by category or SNOMED code. Epic categories are laboratory, vital-signs, social-history, core-characteristics, LDA, LDA-property, LDA-assessment, functional-mental-status, periodontal, labor-delivery, newborn-delivery, obstetrics-gynecology, survey, sdoh, and imaging. Supported SNOMED codes include 384821006, 118228005, 252275004, 275711006, 68793005, 395124008, 314076009, 19851009, and 405825005.

searchParam.name: code
searchParam.documentation: Refine a search for Observation resources by LOINC code, SNOMED code, flowsheet row IDs, or SmartData Identifiers. Codes associated with the labor-delivery and newborn-delivery categories require that the category be specified.

searchParam.name: date
searchParam.documentation: Refine a search for Observation resources by specifying a date or date range that an Observation was resulted or recorded. Enter dates in ISO format (YYYY[-MM[-DD[THH:MM[:SS][TZ]]]]). Local server time is assumed if time zone information is not included.

searchParam.name: focus
searchParam.documentation: Refine a search for Observation resources by specifying a Reference associated with the Observation.

searchParam.name: issued
searchParam.documentation: Refine a search for Observation resources by specifying a date or date range that an Observation was made available. Enter dates in ISO format (YYYY[-MM[-DD[THH:MM[:SS][TZ]]]]). Local server time is assumed if time zone information is not included.

searchParam.name: patient
searchParam.documentation: Search for Observation resources for a specified patient ID. You can use "patient" or "subject" equivalently, but they cannot be used at the same time for different references.

searchParam.name: subject
searchParam.documentation: Search for Observation resources for a specified patient ID. You can use "patient" or "subject" equivalently, but they cannot be used at the same time for different references.

searchParam.name: _count
searchParam.documentation: Number of results per page.

searchParam.name: _id
searchParam.documentation: FHIR resource IDs for the desired resources. Can be used in combination with _count, _include, and _revInclude. All others will be ignored.

searchParam.name: _count
searchParam.documentation: Number of results per page.

searchParam.name: _id
searchParam.documentation: FHIR resource IDs for the desired resources. Can be used in combination with _count, _include, and _revInclude. All others will be ignored.

searchParam.name: address
searchParam.documentation: Search for Patient resources using an address string.

searchParam.name: address-city
searchParam.documentation: Search for Patient resources using the city for a patient's home address. You can use this parameter along with other address parameters.

searchParam.name: address-postalcode
searchParam.documentation: Search for Patient resources using the postal code for a patient's home address. You can use this parameter along with other address parameters.

searchParam.name: address-state
searchParam.documentation: Search for Patient resources using the state for a patient's home address. You can use this parameter along with other address parameters.

searchParam.name: birthdate
searchParam.documentation: Search for Patient resources using a date of birth in ISO format (YYYY-MM-DD).

searchParam.name: doc-type
searchParam.documentation: Search for Patient resources using Singapore document type. This parameter is only used in Singapore environment and is only respected if a Singapore document ID is passed in as one of the identifiers.

searchParam.name: family
searchParam.documentation: Search for Patient resources by family (last) name. You can use the family parameter along with other name parameters to search by a patient's name. Family name searching supports exact matching, "sounds like" matching, and patient aliases.

searchParam.name: gender
searchParam.documentation: Search for Patient resources using the following gender codes: female, male, other, or unknown.

searchParam.name: given
searchParam.documentation: Search for Patient resources by given (first) name.  You can use the given parameter along with other name parameters to search by a patient's name. Given name searching supports both exact and "sounds like" matches. Patient aliases and dominant name aliases (ex. Bob for Robert) are also supported.

searchParam.name: identifier
searchParam.documentation: Search for Patient resources by a patient's identifier. You can use the identifier parameter as the only parameter in a search or in conjunction with other parameters. A patient's identifier must be in the format {<code system>|}<code> or {<ID Type>|}<ID>.

searchParam.name: legal-sex
searchParam.documentation: Search for Patient resources using the following gender codes: female, male, nonbinary, x, other, or unknown.

searchParam.name: name
searchParam.documentation: Search for Patient resources by a patient's name. To search on specific name parts use the name part parameters, such as family or given. This parameter is ignored if any name part parameters are used.

searchParam.name: own-name
searchParam.documentation: Search for Patient resources by patient's own last name, usually used in non-US names. You can use the own-name parameter along with other name parameters to search by a patient's name.

searchParam.name: own-prefix
searchParam.documentation: Search for Patient resources by patient's own last name prefix, usually used in non-US names. You can use the own-prefix parameter along with other name parameters to search by a patient's name, but own-name must also be included.

searchParam.name: partner-name
searchParam.documentation: Search for Patient resources by patient's spouse's last name, usually used in non-US names. You can use the partner-name parameter along with other name parameters to search by a patient's name, but own-name must also be included.

searchParam.name: partner-prefix
searchParam.documentation: Search for Patient resources by patient's spouse's last name prefix, usually used in non-US names. You can use the partner-prefix parameter along with other name parameters to search by a patient's name, but own-name must also be included.

searchParam.name: telecom
searchParam.documentation: Search for Patient resources using a patient's home phone number, cell phone number, or email address.

searchParam.name: _count
searchParam.documentation: Number of results per page.

searchParam.name: _id
searchParam.documentation: FHIR resource IDs for the desired resources. Can be used in combination with _count, _include, and _revInclude. All others will be ignored.

searchParam.name: address
searchParam.documentation: Any part of an address (street, city, etc.) where a practitioner can be visited. When used, family is also required. Only respected if no other address parameters are populated. Only the first instance of this parameter is respected.

searchParam.name: address-city
searchParam.documentation: The city where a practitioner can be visited. When used, address-state is also required. Only the first instance of this parameter is respected.

searchParam.name: address-postalcode
searchParam.documentation: The zip code where a practitioner can be found. When used, family is also required.

searchParam.name: address-state
searchParam.documentation: The state where a practitioner can be found. When used, family is also required. Only the first instance of this parameter is respected.

searchParam.name: family
searchParam.documentation: A practitioner's family (last) name. Only the first instance of this parameter is respected.

searchParam.name: given
searchParam.documentation: A practitioner's given (first) name. When used, family is also required. Only the first instance of this parameter is respected.

searchParam.name: identifier
searchParam.documentation: A practitioner's identifier in the format <code system>|<code>. When this parameter is provided, all others (except _id) are ignored.

searchParam.name: name
searchParam.documentation: Any part of a practitioner's name. For full names, format should be first last. When specified, family and given are ignored. Only the first instance of this parameter is respected.

searchParam.name: _count
searchParam.documentation: Number of results per page.

searchParam.name: _id
searchParam.documentation: FHIR resource IDs for the desired resources. Can be used in combination with _count, _include, and _revInclude. All others will be ignored.

searchParam.name: email
searchParam.documentation: Refine a search for a PractitionerRole by entering a valid email address. Code system is ignored.

searchParam.name: identifier
searchParam.documentation: Search for PractitionerRoles using identifiers. A code system is required. The code must be prepended with URN:OID. Some codes may need to be URL encoded prior to query.

searchParam.name: location
searchParam.documentation: Search for PractitionerRoles using a Location ID. Only the first instance of this parameter is respected.

searchParam.name: organization
searchParam.documentation: Search for PractitionerRoles using an Organization ID. Only the first instance of this parameter is respected.

searchParam.name: phone
searchParam.documentation: Refine a search for a PractitionerRole by entering a valid phone number. Code system is ignored.

searchParam.name: practitioner
searchParam.documentation: Search for PractitionerRoles for a specified Practitioner ID. Only the first instance of this parameter is respected.

searchParam.name: role
searchParam.documentation: Refine a search for a PractitionerRole by entering a valid role. System must be included.

searchParam.name: specialty
searchParam.documentation: Search for PractitionerRoles for a given specialty. A code system is required. Depending on the organization, NUCC may be supported.

searchParam.name: telecom
searchParam.documentation: Refine a search for a PractitionerRole for a specific telecom. System must be specified as either 'phone' or 'email'

searchParam.name: _count
searchParam.documentation: Number of results per page.

searchParam.name: _id
searchParam.documentation: FHIR resource IDs for the desired resources. Can be used in combination with _count, _include, and _revInclude. All others will be ignored.

searchParam.name: category
searchParam.documentation: Refine a search for Procedure resources by category. Only the following values are supported: 103693007 (diagnostic procedures), 387713003 (surgical procedures), 9632001 (nursing procedures, Netherlands only), 225317005 or freedom-restricting-intervention (restricting intervention, Netherlands only), and 410606002 (SDOH intervention) are supported.

searchParam.name: code
searchParam.documentation: Refine a search for Procedure based on code.

searchParam.name: date
searchParam.documentation: Refine a search for Procedure resources by specifying a date or date range that a Procedure was resulted. Enter dates in ISO format (YYYY[-MM[-DD]]).

searchParam.name: identifier
searchParam.documentation: Refine a search for Procedure by identifier.

searchParam.name: patient
searchParam.documentation: Search for Procedure resources for a specified patient ID. You can use "patient" or "subject" equivalently, but they cannot be used at the same time for different references.

searchParam.name: subject
searchParam.documentation: Search for Procedure resources for a specified patient ID. You can use "patient" or "subject" equivalently, but they cannot be used at the same time for different references.

searchParam.name: _count
searchParam.documentation: Number of results per page.

searchParam.name: _id
searchParam.documentation: FHIR resource IDs for the desired resources. Can be used in combination with _count, _include, and _revInclude. All others will be ignored.

searchParam.name: _count
searchParam.documentation: Number of results per page.

searchParam.name: _id
searchParam.documentation: FHIR resource IDs for the desired resources. Can be used in combination with _count, _include, and _revInclude. All others will be ignored.

searchParam.name: encounter
searchParam.documentation: Search for QuestionnaireResponses by encounter

searchParam.name: patient
searchParam.documentation: Search for QuestionnaireResponses for a specified patient. You can also use "subject" equivalently

searchParam.name: subject
searchParam.documentation: Search for QuestionnaireResponses for a specified patient or research subject. You can also use "patient" equivalently if subject references a patient.

searchParam.name: _count
searchParam.documentation: Number of results per page.

searchParam.name: _id
searchParam.documentation: FHIR resource IDs for the desired resources. Can be used in combination with _count, _include, and _revInclude. All others will be ignored.

searchParam.name: _count
searchParam.documentation: Number of results per page.

searchParam.name: _id
searchParam.documentation: FHIR resource IDs for the desired resources. Can be used in combination with _count, _include, and _revInclude. All others will be ignored.

searchParam.name: _count
searchParam.documentation: Number of results per page.

searchParam.name: _id
searchParam.documentation: FHIR resource IDs for the desired resources. Can be used in combination with _count, _include, and _revInclude. All others will be ignored.

searchParam.name: identifier
searchParam.documentation: Search for the ResearchStudy resource for a specified study code or NCT number

searchParam.name: status
searchParam.documentation: Search for the ResearchStudy resource for a specified status

searchParam.name: _count
searchParam.documentation: Number of results per page.

searchParam.name: _id
searchParam.documentation: FHIR resource IDs for the desired resources. Can be used in combination with _count, _include, and _revInclude. All others will be ignored.

searchParam.name: patient
searchParam.documentation: Search for the ResearchSubject resources related to a specified patient

searchParam.name: status
searchParam.documentation: Search for the ResearchSubject resources for a specified status.

searchParam.name: study
searchParam.documentation: Search for the ResearchSubject resources related to a specified study

searchParam.name: _count
searchParam.documentation: Number of results per page.

searchParam.name: _id
searchParam.documentation: FHIR resource IDs for the desired resources. Can be used in combination with _count, _include, and _revInclude. All others will be ignored.

searchParam.name: authored
searchParam.documentation: Refine a search for ServiceRequests for a particular date and time. By default, all ServiceRequests are returned.

searchParam.name: category
searchParam.documentation: Refine a search for ServiceRequests of a particular category. By default, all ServiceRequests are returned.

searchParam.name: code
searchParam.documentation: Refine a search for ServiceRequest based on code. By default all service requests are returned.

searchParam.name: encounter
searchParam.documentation: Search for ServiceRequest resources for specific encounters. If not provided, all ServiceRequest results are returned.

searchParam.name: identifier
searchParam.documentation: Refine a search for ServiceRequest by identifier.

searchParam.name: onlyscannable
searchParam.documentation: Refine a search for ServiceRequest resources to scannable only. By default, all ServiceRequests are returned. Use a value of "true" to only return scannable ServiceRequests. Can only be used when the application is launched from Hyperspace.

searchParam.name: patient
searchParam.documentation: Search ServiceRequest resources for a specified patient ID. You can use "patient" or "subject" equivalently, but they cannot be used at the same time for different references.

searchParam.name: requester
searchParam.documentation: Refine a search for ServiceRequest resources by individual making the request. By default, all ServiceRequests are returned.

searchParam.name: status
searchParam.documentation: Refine a search for ServiceRequest resources by status. By default, all ServiceRequests are returned. Statuses of draft, active, completed, revoked, and unknown are supported.

searchParam.name: subject
searchParam.documentation: Search ServiceRequest resources for a specified patient ID. You can use "patient" or "subject" equivalently but they cannot be used at the same time for different references.

searchParam.name: _count
searchParam.documentation: Number of results per page.

searchParam.name: _id
searchParam.documentation: FHIR resource IDs for the desired resources. Can be used in combination with _count, _include, and _revInclude. All others will be ignored.

searchParam.name: _count
searchParam.documentation: Number of results per page.

searchParam.name: _id
searchParam.documentation: FHIR resource IDs for the desired resources. Can be used in combination with _count, _include, and _revInclude. All others will be ignored.

searchParam.name: _count
searchParam.documentation: Number of results per page.

searchParam.name: _id
searchParam.documentation: FHIR resource IDs for the desired resources. Can be used in combination with _count, _include, and _revInclude. All others will be ignored.

searchParam.name: code
searchParam.documentation: Specify community-resource for CRRN tasks, episode-checklist for Episode Checklist tasks. When nothing is specified, all valid tasks are returned.

searchParam.name: encounter
searchParam.documentation: Further refine the search for a task by specifying the encounter associated with the task.

searchParam.name: patient
searchParam.documentation: Search for Task resources for a specified patient ID. You can use "patient" or "subject" equivalently, but they cannot be used at the same time for different references.

searchParam.name: status
searchParam.documentation: Restrict the search for tasks based on task status.

searchParam.name: subject
searchParam.documentation: Search for Task resources for a specified patient ID. You can use "patient" or "subject" equivalently, but they cannot be used at the same time for different references.

searchParam.name: _count
searchParam.documentation: Number of results per page.

searchParam.name: _id
searchParam.documentation: FHIR resource IDs for the desired resources. Can be used in combination with _count, _include, and _revInclude. All others will be ignored.
